dc:title:
From Union Square to Rome,
Chapter 6 - New York
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Recounts the misery of New York in 1916, her loneliness, and life in tenements among the ethnic poor. Describes her first newspaper job with The Call, the competing social ideologies, and sporadic strikes and protests.
dc:identifier: Dorothy Day Library on the Web document 206 1938-01-08 James Allaire Creative Commons Non-Commercial Share Alike 3.0 en-US http://www.catholicworker.org/dorothyday
